content.description: Aka Find Your Funk Direct. Start and climb as per Find Your Funk but rather than going to the “sharp fin” and rounding the left corner of the boulder, top out the boulder direct.

Sit start matched on the jug block. Move up using the corner feature straight up and various holds out left. Flexible hips are a plus. The difficulty comes down low, but don't slip on the topout slab. Probably on the tough end of V2, but with some cool, if occasionally bizarre, moves (there may be an easier way than how I did it, though).
content.location: Facing uphill on the downstream side of the boulder.

content.description: Mellow layback on a juggy flake feature. Really nice movement.
content.location: The stream-facing side of the Jazz boulder. Look for the corner feature.

content.description: Sit start with a left hand on a low slopey jug, right hand on a sharpish jug ledge. Move up and left using whatever features suit you best, top out moving around the left corner and climbing up on the sharp fin of rock sticking up from the left side of the boulder. So named for the huge number of options for sequences, the only constant being that the moves are bound to be at least a little funky.
content.location: Upstream side of the Jazz boulder, starts middle-right of the face and moves left and up.

content.description: A large, slightly fragmented boulder sat near the river. Has a moderate project and one slightly harder line, as well as a very nice and easy, but rather scary, highball layback. Downclimb is the low-angle slab on the uphill side. The boulder is named for the idiosyncratic style of movement found on most of the problems.
